data:
Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Myrcella,

 

Most places in your budget are going to be a little further off-campus.

Here’s a studio and one-bedroom apartment in Historic Downtown Corvallis http://www.gazettetimes.com/ads/housing/rent/apartment/studio-bdrm-up-historic-corvallis-downtown-bldg-on-site/ad_2df6610e-c4b2-543e-bad4-8cfdcd441aa0.html

Here’s another studio several blocks north of campus http://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5728637799.html 

 

You can also e-mail housing@oregonstate.edu <mailto:housing@oregonstate.edu>  for more advice.

 

--Charles “Chatty Chuck” Chatsworth

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Thursday, September 15, 2016 1:05 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Housing... OMG!

 

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Saving money is so important, Chuck. I have to make my parents happy with me. I’ll try that second one close to campus. 

 

Thanks for finding these places. I’m so bad at the internet!

 

--Myr

 

From: Chatsworth, Charles 
Sent: Thursday, September 15, 2016 1:14 PM
To: Baratheon, Myrcella <Myrcella.Baratheon@oregonstate.edu>
Subject: RE:  Housing... OMG!

Here’s another studio several blocks north of campus http://corvallis.craigslist.org/apa/5728637799.html 

 

You can also e-mail housing@oregonstate.edu <mailto:housing@oregonstate.edu>  for more advice.

 

--Charles “Chatty Chuck” Chatsworth

Hi there,
As you are a year ahead of me, could I get a little help finding housing for me for this next Fall term at OSU? I tried looking at Craigslist, but I can’t tell what’s good and what’s not!
I’m on a budget, so let’s keep it under $700 a month. And no roommate! If you can, find a place that doesn’t accept cats or dogs. Please send me links to the best place or two that you find!
Thank you ever so much, 
Myrcella

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Hey Myrcella.

 

It looks like it’s going to be about 72 degrees both Saturday and Sunday, just overcast Saturday but it will probably rain on Sunday! Bring sunscreen just to be safe, but I would bring a sweater and something impermeable for Sunday in case the weather turns bad.

 

--Charles

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Thursday, September 15, 2016 1:16 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Weather?

 

 

Hi!

 

There’s a picnic in the woods near Alsea that we’re supposed to go to this weekend. We may also hike to the waterfall. Can you please check the weather and let me know what I should wear and if I should bring sunscreen?

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Thanks, Charles. Glad you checked the weather for me. Whenever, I try to find out myself, I get into the middle of a hurricane. The hike sounds like it will be unpredictable – like me!

 

--Myr

Sent: Thursday, September 15, 2016 1:19 PM
To: Baratheon, Myrcella <Myrcella.Baratheon@oregonstate.edu>

Hello Charles,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Hey Myrcella,

 

Here’s an easy recipe for guacamole – everyone likes guacamole! http://allrecipes.com/recipe/14064/easy-guacamole 
Here’s an easy (and super quick) recipe for roasted chick peas, good snacking material http://www.marthastewart.com/326845/spicy-roasted-chickpeas

Something a little sweeter (that everyone should rave about): Chocolate almond pretzels http://www.myrecipes.com/recipe/chocolate-almond-pretzels

 

Those are all gluten-free and vegetarian; here’s one that’s delicious but doesn’t quite fit that bill: http://www.myrecipes.com/recipe/caramelized-onion-and-goat-cheese-bread 

 

Good luck with your event!

 

--Chatty Chuck

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Thursday, September 15, 2016 1:20 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Awesome recipes

 

 

Hello Charles,

 

I am planning an event at my sorority this weekend and I could use some ideas for food to make as appetizers. I am expecting to have 20 people at the event and would like to include options for those who are vegetarian or gluten free. I will have about an hour to make these ahead of time so please keep that in mind as you research. It’s really important that people love the event, so try and pick some recipes that people will rave about!

 

Please email me three or four recipes that I can consider for appetizers.  

 

Thank you, 

 

Myrcella

Spicy roasted chickpeas… awesome… for Corvallis? :) I’m sure all my sisters will love the pretzels and the guacamole, though! 

 

Thanks for these wonderful ideas. I think it will be great. Two normal dishes and one exotic dish. Sort of like how I am :)

 

--Myr

Sent: Thursday, September 15, 2016 1:30 PM

Hello Charles,

 

Just a friendly reminder that I’ll need the following two books soon and you promised to help me buy them for a good price! :)

 

Please find them wherever you can, just make sure you will receive them by next week for classes. My budget is at most 200 dollars to get these two textbooks, but please please please try and find the best available prices.

 

Textbooks Needed:

Engineering Economic Analysis by Donald Newnan 12th edition IBSN: 978-0199339273

 

Robert Love, Linux Kernel Development 3/e, Addison-Wesley, 2010, ISBN: 978-1-672-32946-3

 

Email me back with where to buy them for the best price so they’ll arrive next week! I owe you lunch for this big help!

 

Thanks! :) :) :)

Myrcella

Myrcella,

 

It looks like you can get Engineering Economic Analysis from Amazon used for about $70 here https://www.amazon.com/Engineering-Economic-Analysis-Donald-Newnan/dp/0199339279/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1473971695&sr=1-1, or you can get the paperback version used for about $25 including shipping on that same page.

 

You can get the Linux book also on Amazon for about $40 https://www.amazon.com/Linux-Kernel-Development-Robert-Love/dp/0672329468/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1473971808&sr=1-1&keywords=linux+kernel+development+3rd+edition (also, you got the ISBN wrong for this one)

 

In my experience Amazon is usually going to be your best bet for getting the books shipped in a timely fashion.

 

--Chatty Chuck

 

 

 

From: Baratheon, Myrcella 
Sent: Thursday, September 15, 2016 1:33 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Textbook help reminder!

Thanks! :) :) :)

Myrcella

Wow, $70 vs. $25. I think I’ll save the money. It’s like a nice cover is going to improve economics anytime soon!

 

Thanks, as always, for your masterful internet kung-fu! I’ll order these right away.

 

Best,

Myr

Hi, Charles ,
 
Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 
 
I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 
 
What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.
 
Thank you so much! 

Melisandre

Melisandre,

 

You may enjoy True Detective; it has a 9.1/10 rating on IMDb, was nominated for four Golden Globes in its first season. It’s also produced by HBO, who does Game of Thrones, so you know it’s probably good.

 

A show a little more like House of Cards and Homeland is West Wing, my roommate watched it all of last year and it looked pretty captivating. 8.8/10 on IMDb, and has won two Golden Globes.

 

--Chatty Chuck

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu] 
Sent: Thursday, September 15, 2016 1:52 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Best TV Show to Watch

 

Hi, Charles ,

 

Game of Thrones season six is over and I really need something new to watch! I just don’t know what would be good. 

 

I’m a big fan of action dramas such as House of Cards and Homeland (all of which I’ve already seen, unfortunately). 

 

What’s the next best show after these three? I don’t want to be fooled into watching something bad, so please see if the critics agree that the show is really excellent. Some rankings would also help give me confidence the show will be worthwhile.

 

Thank you so much! 


Melisandre

Chatty,

I'll definitely have a look at True Detective...think I heard our classmates talking about it.

Melisandre

Hi there!
 
I need to buy a gift for a friend.
 
My friend loves the outdoors and the color pink.
She’s 22 years old and her birthday is in a week (7 days).
I will need something that will get here on time.
Nothing that will take too long to ship please.
 
I have 30 dollars to spend on my friend.
Please spend as close to that as you can.
 
Please email me the link(s) to the gift(s) you find and include how much they cost.
 
Thank you,
Melisandre

Hey Melisandre,

 

Pretty much everyone that loves the outdoors could use a Hydroflask (although I couldn’t find one in pink!) https://www.amazon.com/Hydro-Flask-Insulated-Stainless-Standard/dp/B016V42WHW/ref=sr_1_4?s=outdoor-recreation&ie=UTF8&qid=1473973690&sr=1-4&keywords=pink+hydro+flask+24+oz $30

 

A water filter wouldn’t go wrong in a pinch either https://www.rei.com/product/890900/sawyer-mini-water-filter 

 

Tell her happy birthday for me!

--Chuck

 

From: Lannister, Melisandre [mailto:Melisandre.Lannister@oregonstate.edu]

Melisandre

Chuck,

Thanks for finding my friend's presents for me. I don't know what I'd do without you!


Melisandre

Hi there,

 

I heard from a friend that you are the one to talk to about this subject.

 

Unfortunately, my friend has to take two strong medications together - Adderall, and Valium. Are there any issues (contraindications) with taking them both together? Is there anything (food, activities, etc.) that he needs to avoid? I just want him to be safe. Please send a list of what you find, along with links to your resources.

 

Thanks for volunteering to check it out!

 

Davos

Davos,

 

Your friend shouldn’t drive on pretty much any prescribed medication, particularly Adderall and Valium. They don’t have any known contraindications according to the internet, but make sure he asks his doctor! They know more than idiots on the web. Tell him not to drink alcohol (it will interact with Valium) or fruit juices (Vitamin C will reduce the potency of Adderall). Also, if he notices any side effects from either medication make sure he contacts his doctor immediately.

 

https://www.drugs.com/adderall.html

https://www.drugs.com/valium.html

 

-Chuck

 

From: Stark, Davos 
Sent: Thursday, September 15, 2016 3:16 PM
To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  check on medication

Wow Chuck,

 

You sure know your stuff! I’m so glad I contacted you first. Let’s keep this convo between us, eh?

 

Thanks again,

Davos

Hello Charles,

 

I know graduating is coming up soon for you. It would be good to do a preliminary job search. Please find at least 1 job and send me an email with the link(s) to the job(s) you applied for. 

 

 

Here is the link for one job search site to get started. 

 

http://www.indeed.com 

 

Job criteria: 

 

You should find a computer engineering job. 

 

Must start after September 2016.

 

For now, just find one or more jobs you believe will work out well. We can talk about them further at our next meeting.

 

Sincerely, 

 

Davos

Davos,

 

Here’s a job that I think I would do well in! http://www.indeed.com/cmp/AltSource,-Inc./jobs/Software-Developer-9c6e4477c0783b91?sjdu=QwrRXKrqZ3CNX5W-O9jEvRFd8FQI4DEv5V74lSpSnHYCu4GzRJ9dzbv9x1cpX6cb6gvVqME_WXqVvK1XIrZHLg

 

Thanks,

--Chuck

Hello Charles, 

 

I am your academic advisor and a highly esteemed professor…they seem contradictory, I know.

 

Below is a list of classes you must enroll in for Fall Term 2016: 

 

ST 314 

PAC 201 

WR 121 

COMM 111 

H 100 

Note** Do not worry if there is no space in the class. I will make sure you get a spot in the class. 

 

In order to view the available times for these classes please use the OSU catalog <http://catalog.oregonstate.edu/Default.aspx?section=Course> . 

 

Please provide me with a list of the CRNs so that I can finish your registration process. 

Once you have been registered, I will provide you with the list of textbooks you will need for your classes. Since the textbook selection will be shared, we require all textbooks be acquired legally. 

 

Thank you, 

Professor Targaryen

Hey Arya,

 

Here are the CRNs I want for my classes:

ST 314: 20855 (TR 8:00-9:20)

PAC 201: 10050 (MW 13:00-13:50)

WR 121: 10094 (MWF 8:00-8:50)

To: Chatsworth, Charles <Charles.Chatsworth@oregonstate.edu>
Subject:  Create an Ideal Class Schedule

 

Hello Charles, 

 

I am your academic advisor and a highly esteemed professor…they seem contradictory, I know.

 

Below is a list of classes you must enroll in for Fall Term 2016: 

 

ST 314 

PAC 201 

WR 121 

COMM 111 

H 100 

Note** Do not worry if there is no space in the class. I will make sure you get a spot in the class. 

 

In order to view the available times for these classes please use the OSU catalog <http://catalog.oregonstate.edu/Default.aspx?section=Course> . 

 

Please provide me with a list of the CRNs so that I can finish your registration process.

Thank you, 

Professor Targaryen

Greetings, traveler,

 

I hear you’re are interested in exploring Eastern Europe with our group. Recently the group is wondering whether or not it is safe to travel right now. We need to do some research and see what we can find out.

 

The plan is to land in Istanbul. Next, we will be traveling to Sofia, the capital of Bulgaria.  After Sofia, the next step is some car travel to Macedonia and then onwards to Albania. Our last stop will be Tirana, in Albania.

 

The group would like to have some information sent to me to start this travel planning out:

 

A quick overview of each country’s political climate - I don’t want anyone getting into trouble and having this turn into some geopolitical affair! Is the country at war with a US ally? Is the country in political turmoil? Is there a US embassy? Is it safe to travel there now?

 

This will be a good start for the travel planning. Please research these items and send the information to me right away.

 

Kind regards,

Davos Stark

Eastern Reaches, an OSU Travel Group

Davos,

 

Here is what I’ve found about each of those areas.

 

Istanbul:

Political climate: Civil War

US Embassy: Yes

Safe to Travel: Would recommend being as safe as possible if you have to go through Istanbul.

Sofia

Political climate: Stable

US Embassy: Yes

Safe to Travel: Yes

Macedonia

Political climate: Stable (some economic strife)

US Embassy: Yes

Safe to Travel: Yes

Tirana

Political climate: Stable. Pretty unequal economically

US Embassy: Yes

Safe to Travel: You should buy travel insurance (as always) but you should be okay

 

--Chuck
